sub_title: Knowledge Coordinator international relations & security @ House of Representatives | Assistant prof. terrorism studies @ Universiteit Leiden
summary:
Kenniscoördinator Internationale betrekkingen met een focus op geopolitiek en internationale veiligheid bij de Dienst Analyse en Onderzoek van de Tweede Kamer. Mijn werkzaamheden zijn commissie-overstijgend en ik probeer daarmee inzichten en kennis te verbinden in het domein van internationale vraagstukken. Hierbij werk ik primair voor de vaste kamercommissies voor Buitenlandse Zaken, Defensie en de griffie interparlementaire betrekkingen. Tevens zit ik de kennisgroep die zich richt op het binnenhalen van kennis in de Tweede Kamer en tegelijkertijd ook probeert het (kennis)werk van de Tweede Kamer meer zichtbaar te maken voor de samenleving.

Daarnaast ben ik voor 1 dag per week verbonden aan de Universiteit Leiden als universitair docent terrorismestudies bij het Institute of Security and Global Affairs (ISGA).

Onderzoeker en docent met brede ervaring en interesse op het gebied van vraagstukken rond veiligheid en internationale betrekkingen. Mijn streven is om kennis relevant en toepasbaar te maken en verschillende werelden met elkaar te verbinden. 

----

Broad interest and the ability to quickly assess and analyse issue due to my interdisciplinary skills.

Driven, enthusiastic, diligent, hands-on and analytical - I like to work with colleagues to develop new initiatives, teach and apply our research while I am also able to work independently and achieve results in complex and long-term projects. My aim is to connect academic work with the wider policy field and society.

Finished a PhD dissertation on how societies have responded to terrorist attacks. Together with Prof. Edwin Bakker, I have developed a MOOC (massive open online course) on Coursera and FutureLearn on (counter)terrorism which has attracted over 180.000 participants from 80 countries.

I have developed management experience in various roles, such as part of the steering committee of the European Expert Network on Terrorism Issues and the Institute Board of Leiden University's Institute of Security and Global Affairs.

Experienced in lecturing for public and professional audiences with a network in the national & international policy world linked to security.

projects.title: Coursera course (MOOC) "Terrorism & Counterterrorism. Comparing Theory & Practice"
projects.description:
This is a 'MOOC', a massive open online course on the platform Coursera. 

Terrorism has arguably been one of the defining factors of our age. It frequently makes headlines, threatening or attacking governments, private business and ordinary citizens. And in many parts of the world, it has been one of the most important threats to peace, security and stability. But what does this exactly mean? What is the nature of this threat? Who or what is threatened, how, by whom and why? What can be done about it or how can we at least limit the impact of terrorism and make sure that terrorists do not make headlines and manage to scare us?

These are just a handful of questions that will be addressd in this course that consists of three parts. First it focuses on the essence of terrorism as an instrument to achieve certain goals, in addition to an exploration of this phenomenon and the difficulties in defining it. The second part provides an overview of the state of the art in (counter) terrorism studies. Since ‘9/11’ terrorism studies have grown exponentially, reflecting the rise in perceived threats. But what has academia come up with? What theories, assumptions and conventional wisdom has it produced that could be of help in understanding terrorism and dealing with it? The most interesting results are examined and compared with empirical evidence with the aim to either stress their importance or to debunk them as myths. The final part looks into the implications and possibilities for policy making.

As a Research Fellow at the ICCT, I contribute to a number of research projects and publications.
- I was one of the main researchers in the EU-funded "Countering Lone-Actor Terrorism" project (CLAT) in a consortium with Chatham House, Royal United Service Institute (RUSI) and the Institute for Strategic Dialogue.
- I was a junior researcher in the NATO-funded "Transitions from Military Interventions to Long-Term Counterterrorism Policy" project, where I co-authored the case study on Libya and organised high-level meetings with former ministers of Defense. 
- Been asked to deliver expert workshops and lectures on numerous occasions
- Wrote several policy briefs and research papers for ICCT on foreign fighters & commemorating terrorism

volunteer_experiences.description:
Member of the board/treasurer of Utrecht University's alumni network in The Hague. We organise dinners for alumni in and around The Hague in Brasserie Berlage. Renowned speakers with a link to the UU are invited to give a lecture during these "themadiners"​. 

The network has also initiated the "Hofvijverkring"​. The Hofvijverkring consists of a small group of alumni who are dedicated to providing financial support to scientific research and education at Utrecht University. This enables the network to give considerable support to scientists working on excellent, ground-breaking research.
